intro: Glochidion macrosepalum, commonly known as the large-sepal glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Glochidion macrosepalum is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, tropical conditions.
